page.title: 04VIEWS FROM STUBHAMPTON AREA
page.content: This part of Dorset is exceedingly beautiful and full of contrasts, being the area where the escarpment bounding Cranborne Chase meets the edge of the Blackmore Vale. The views are superb, ranging across farmland to Hambledon Hill, Bulbarrow and beyond. From a vantage point on the hill it is possible to see across the downs to a large part of Hampshire, the Isle of Wight and the Needles. To the east, natural woodlands and plantations carry the eye down to Stubhampton Bottom with its variety of trees and cultivated farmland. There are few signs of habitation, except one or two farms and cottages, and one historic house, West Lodge, with fine views to the Solent, and landscaped gardens and tree belts.
